#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Be a Polite Vegan/Vegetarian in Social Situations
#Text=If you are a long-time vegetarian or newly-turned vegan , you might find that some social situations can be awkward .
#Text=However , this little list can help fellow veggies get through such situations .
#Text=Steps
#Text=As a Guest
#Text=Remember that when the host or hostess of a party does make a special vegetarian dish for you , be sure to thank them at the party , and also send them a note following the party .
#Text=Know that when someone offers you a non-vegetarian/non-vegan dish to try , you can simply say , " No Thanks " .
#Text=Make a point to mention how much you liked a vegetarian dish .
#Text=Hosting Your Own Event

#Text=Try to make foods which are familiar to most people , such as falafels , hummus , vegetable soups , bean chili , salad , salsa , pasta salad , and vegan versions of common sweet-foods such as cookies and cakes .
#Text=Let people bring their own dishes as well .

#Text=While vegan and vegetarian meals are no different than regular meals ( except for the fact that they do n't have animal products ) and are just as tasty , some people may not care for them or be open to trying them .
#Text=At a Restaurant
#Text=Be polite and patient when asking the waiter about which dishes could be made without animal products .
#Text=If you do ask a lot of the servers , tip them appropriately .
#Text=Realize that you may have to skimp a bit or make do .
#Text=If all of their entrees use meat or animal products , it might be easier to just order a sandwich and a few " safe " side dishes instead of insisting they make special accommodations .
#Text=This is especially wise in busy restaurants .
#Text=If at all possible , contact the restaurant before you arrive and inform them of your special requirements .
#Text=Most chefs are happy to accommodate any diet , some even see it as a welcome change of pace .
#Text=However , a little time for planning can mean the difference between passable food and stunning food .
#Text=If little is available , be gracious and simply order a drink and some side dishes .
#Text=Remember that dining out should also be about the company , and raising a fuss can make for an uncomfortable if not ruined dining experience .
#Text=If you know you are stuck going to a restaurant that has little to offer , be proactive -- eat before you go , and order coffee and dessert , or a soda and salad at the destination .
#Text=If you are with a group of co-workers , there often is one " motherly " person in the group who encourages you to order some meat because he or she noticed you did n't .
#Text=Just smile and say you are happy with what you ordered .
#Text=Most of the time , two or three side dishes will be a satisfying meal
#Text=Tips
#Text=Do n't feel embarrassed that you 're a vegetarian or vegan .
#Text=When going out for the day , it 's always good to carry a protein bar with you , so if you ca n't find someplace to have lunch or dinner , you 'll at least have some food .
